messages.content: You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What's my activity count by month this year? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(date_trunc('month', ua.activity_timestamp), 'Mon YYYY') AS month, COUNT(*)::int AS count FROM user_activity ua WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('year', CURRENT_DATE) GROUP BY date_trunc('month', ua.activity_timestamp) ORDER BY date_trunc('month', ua.activity_timestamp)"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my squats workouts [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, sa.name AS sub_activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_sub_activity uasa ON ua.user_activity_id = uasa.user_activity_id JOIN sub_activity sa ON uasa.sub_activity_id = sa.sub_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND sa.name ILIKE '%squat%' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How long was my average run this month? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT AVG(uad.duration_in_sec) AS avg_duration_sec FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'run') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE)"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What activities have I done with friends? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, ua.comments FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND (ua.comments ILIKE '%friend%' OR ua.comments ILIKE '%partner%' OR ua.comments ILIKE '%buddy%') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my jump rope sessions [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'jump | rope | skip') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What's my total running time? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT SUM(uad.duration_in_sec) AS total_seconds FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'run') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
List my afternoon activities [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'HH12:MI PM') AS time FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) BETWEEN 12 AND 17 ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my elliptical workouts [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, uad.duration_in_sec AS duration_seconds FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'elliptical') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What's my least active day of the week? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT CASE EXTRACT(dow FROM ua.activity_timestamp) WHEN 0 THEN 'Sunday' WHEN 1 THEN 'Monday' WHEN 2 THEN 'Tuesday' WHEN 3 THEN 'Wednesday' WHEN 4 THEN 'Thursday' WHEN 5 THEN 'Friday' WHEN 6 THEN 'Saturday' END AS day_of_week, COUNT(*)::int AS activity_count FROM user_activity ua WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' GROUP BY EXTRACT(dow FROM ua.activity_timestamp) ORDER BY activity_count ASC LIMIT 1"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How many activities did I do yesterday? [user_id: abc-123]
{"sqlQuery":"SELECT COUNT(*)::int AS count FROM user_activity ua WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ua.activity_timestamp::date = CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my leg day workouts [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, ua.comments FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND (ua.comments ILIKE '%leg day%' OR ua.comments ILIKE '%legs%' OR ua.activity_name_override ILIKE '%leg%') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What's my sleep pattern this week? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, uad.duration_in_sec / 3600.0 AS hours FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'sleep') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

Show my back exercises [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, sa.name AS sub_activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_sub_activity uasa ON ua.user_activity_id = uasa.user_activity_id JOIN sub_activity sa ON uasa.sub_activity_id = sa.sub_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND (sa.name ILIKE '%back%' OR sa.name ILIKE '%lat%' OR sa.name ILIKE '%row%') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What percentage of my activities are workouts? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT ROUND(100.0 * SUM(CASE WHEN ac.activity_category_code = 'workouts' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END) / COUNT(*), 2) AS workout_percentage FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_category ac ON a.activity_category_id = ac.activity_category_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, sa.name AS sub_activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_sub_activity uasa ON ua.user_activity_id = uasa.user_activity_id JOIN sub_activity sa ON uasa.sub_activity_id = sa.sub_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND sa.name ILIKE '%kettlebell%' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT COUNT(*)::int AS count FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'yoga') AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE)"}

What's my total exercise time this week? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT SUM(uad.duration_in_sec) AS total_seconds FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_category ac ON a.activity_category_id = ac.activity_category_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ac.activity_category_code IN ('workouts', 'sports') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day'"}

What's my average distance per cycling session? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT AVG(uad.distance_in_meters) / 1000.0 AS avg_km FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'bike | cycling | cycle') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'distance'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How many hours of sleep did I get last week? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT SUM(uad.duration_in_sec) / 3600.0 AS total_hours FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'sleep') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day' - interval '1 week' AND ua.activity_timestamp < date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

Show my activity pattern by hour [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp)::int AS hour, COUNT(*)::int AS count FROM user_activity ua WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' GROUP BY EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) ORDER BY hour"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What's my longest swim? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, uad.distance_in_meters AS distance_m FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'swim') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' ORDER BY uad.distance_in_meters DESC LIMIT 1"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How did my running improve over the last 6 months? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(date_trunc('month', ua.activity_timestamp), 'Mon YYYY') AS month, AVG((duration_val / 60.0) / (distance_val / 1000.0)) AS avg_pace_min_per_km FROM (SELECT ua.user_activity_id, ua.activity_timestamp, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' THEN uad.duration_in_sec END) AS duration_val, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' THEN uad.distance_in_meters END) AS distance_val FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id JOIN activity_detail ad ON uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'run') AND ad.use_for_pace_calculation = true AND ua.activity_timestamp >= CURRENT_DATE - interval '6 months' GROUP BY ua.user_activity_id, ua.activity_timestamp) sub WHERE distance_val > 0 GROUP BY date_trunc('month', activity_timestamp) ORDER BY date_trunc('month', activity_timestamp)"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my chest exercises [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, sa.name AS sub_activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_sub_activity uasa ON ua.user_activity_id = uasa.user_activity_id JOIN sub_activity sa ON uasa.sub_activity_id = sa.sub_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND (sa.name ILIKE '%chest%' OR sa.name ILIKE '%bench%' OR sa.name ILIKE '%fly%') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, uad.distance_in_meters / 1000.0 AS distance_km FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'bike | cycling') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' ORDER BY uad.distance_in_meters DESC LIMIT 1"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, ua.activity_name_override, ua.comments FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'rock | climb | climbing') ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}

Show my activities that lasted over an hour [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, uad.duration_in_sec / 3600.0 AS duration_hours FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' AND uad.duration_in_sec > 3600 ORDER BY uad.duration_in_sec DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
How many different types of yoga have I done? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT COUNT(DISTINCT COALESCE(ua.activity_name_override, a.name))::int AS yoga_types FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'yoga')"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
What's my most common workout time? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT CASE WHEN EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) BETWEEN 5 AND 11 THEN 'Morning' WHEN EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) BETWEEN 12 AND 17 THEN 'Afternoon' ELSE 'Evening' END AS time_of_day, COUNT(*)::int AS count FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_category ac ON a.activity_category_id = ac.activity_category_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ac.activity_category_code = 'workouts' GROUP BY CASE WHEN EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) BETWEEN 5 AND 11 THEN 'Morning' WHEN EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) BETWEEN 12 AND 17 THEN 'Afternoon' ELSE 'Evening' END ORDER BY count DESC LIMIT 1"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.
Show my pull up workouts [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, sa.name AS sub_activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_sub_activity uasa ON ua.user_activity_id = uasa.user_activity_id JOIN sub_activity sa ON uasa.sub_activity_id = sa.sub_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND sa.name ILIKE '%pull%up%' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'HH12:MI PM') AS time FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND (EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) >= 21 OR EXTRACT(hour FROM ua.activity_timestamp) < 5) ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}

How consistent is my sleep schedule? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT STDDEV(uad.duration_in_sec / 3600.0) AS sleep_variability_hours, AVG(uad.duration_in_sec / 3600.0) AS avg_sleep_hours FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'sleep') AND uad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= CURRENT_DATE - interval '30 days'"}
You are an expert Postgres SQL generator. Convert natural language to SQL. Output ONLY valid JSON with a sqlQuery field.

What's my average pace trend for swimming? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(date_trunc('week', activity_timestamp), 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS week, AVG((duration_val / 60.0) / (distance_val / 100.0)) AS avg_pace_min_per_100m FROM (SELECT ua.user_activity_id, ua.activity_timestamp, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'duration' THEN uad.duration_in_sec END) AS duration_val, MAX(CASE WHEN ad.activity_detail_type = 'distance' THEN uad.distance_in_meters END) AS distance_val FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_embedding ae ON a.activity_id = ae.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id JOIN activity_detail ad ON uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ae.fts @@ to_tsquery('english', 'swim') AND ad.use_for_pace_calculation = true AND a.pace_type = 'minutesPer100Uom' GROUP BY ua.user_activity_id, ua.activity_timestamp) sub WHERE distance_val > 0 GROUP BY date_trunc('week', activity_timestamp) ORDER BY date_trunc('week', activity_timestamp)"}

How many sports activities did I do outdoors? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT COUNT(*)::int AS count FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN activity_category ac ON a.activity_category_id = ac.activity_category_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ac.activity_category_code = 'sports' AND uad.environment_value = 'outdoor'"}

Show my lunges workouts [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT to_char(ua.activity_timestamp, 'Mon DD, YYYY') AS date, a.name AS activity, sa.name AS sub_activity FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity a ON ua.activity_id = a.activity_id JOIN user_activity_sub_activity uasa ON ua.user_activity_id = uasa.user_activity_id JOIN sub_activity sa ON uasa.sub_activity_id = sa.sub_activity_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND sa.name ILIKE '%lunge%' ORDER BY ua.activity_timestamp DESC"}

What's my daily step average for this month? [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT AVG(daily_steps)::int AS avg_daily_steps FROM (SELECT ua.activity_timestamp::date AS date, SUM(uad.numeric_value) AS daily_steps FROM user_activity ua JOIN activity_detail ad ON ad.activity_id = ua.activity_id JOIN user_activity_detail uad ON ua.user_activity_id = uad.user_activity_id AND uad.activity_detail_id = ad.activity_detail_id WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ad.label ILIKE '%step%' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('month', CURRENT_DATE) GROUP BY ua.activity_timestamp::date) sub"}

Show my activities comparing this week vs last week [user_id: abc-123]

{"sqlQuery":"SELECT CASE WHEN ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day' THEN 'This Week' ELSE 'Last Week' END AS period, COUNT(*)::int AS activity_count FROM user_activity ua WHERE ua.user_id = 'abc-123' AND ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day' - interval '1 week' GROUP BY CASE WHEN ua.activity_timestamp >= date_trunc('week', CURRENT_DATE - interval '1 day') + interval '1 day' THEN 'This Week' ELSE 'Last Week' END ORDER BY period DESC"}
